content: The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1999" includes changes to the Fund's status and miscellaneous technical corrections. It also covers amendments to programs administered by the Fund and the Bank Enterprise Act of 1991, extension of authorization, amendments to the Small Business Capital Enhancement Program, and additional safeguards. The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1999" aims to create a fund to support economic revitalization and community development through investments in community development financial institutions. It also provides incentives for insured depository institutions to increase lending in distressed communities. The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1999" amends the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994 by redefining the term "Secretary" and replacing "Administrator" with "Secretary" in certain sections. It also establishes a fund within the Department of the Treasury to support economic revitalization and community development through investments in community development financial institutions. The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1999" establishes a Community Development Financial Institutions Fund within the Department of the Treasury as a wholly owned government corporation with specific functions and offices in Washington, D.C. The Fund is not affiliated with any other federal agency and is treated as an agency of the United States. The Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994 is amended to give the Secretary of the Treasury authority over the Fund, including the appointment of officers and employees. Additionally, the Inspector General section is revised. The Inspector General section is revised under SEC. 118. The Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury will also serve as the Inspector General of the Fund. Technical amendments are made to the Inspector General Act of 1978 and the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994. The Secretary may prescribe regulations and procedures to carry out this subtitle. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY THE FUND AND THE BANK ENTERPRISE ACT OF 1991. Amendments to the Community Development Financial Institutions Program include changes to the form of assistance provided and training programs offered through cooperative agreements or grants with other organizations. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act Awards Program include changes to provide assistance to community development financial institutions and low- and moderate-income persons. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act Awards Program aim to increase award amounts for certain activities and award credit for additional qualified activities. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act include expanding the types of assistance deemed appropriate and evaluating technical assistance provided. Amendment to the Bank Enterprise Act includes adding alternative criteria for defining distressed communities. The authorization for funding under the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994 is extended until fiscal year 2003, with increasing amounts allocated each year. Additionally, amendments are made to the Small Business Capital Enhancement Program. Amendments are made to the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994, including changes to the definition of financial institutions, elimination of a threshold appropriation, a conforming amendment, and amendments to reimbursement authority. Amendments to the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 include changes to reimbursement criteria for participating States by the Fund, with reimbursement up to 50% of contributions to reserve funds. Amendments to the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 include changes to reimbursement criteria for participating States by the Fund, with reimbursement up to 50% of contributions to reserve funds. Section 260 of the Act is repealed. SEC. 6. ADDITIONAL SAFEGUARDS. The Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994 is amended to include an objective scoring system for evaluating applications and the formation of multiperson review panels by the Fund. The Fund will convene multiperson review panels to evaluate applications based on specific factors and make recommendations for selections. Panels will consist of at least 3 members appointed based on their education. The Fund will convene multiperson review panels to evaluate applications. Panels will consist of at least 3 members appointed based on their education, training, or experience, with at least 1/3 from diverse backgrounds not affiliated with the government. Annual reports will include information on contractors used by the Fund. The Fund will evaluate contractors used for its functions, detailing services provided, procurement process, authority for contracting, and total amount spent. An evaluation will also assess compliance with requirements under this subtitle and subtitle B of title II. The Fund will evaluate contractors for its functions, including services provided, procurement process, authority for contracting, and total amount spent. An evaluation will also assess compliance with requirements under this subtitle and subtitle B of title II. The 1st annual report to Congress will include a description of the implementation of the scoring system required by the amendment, and a GAO report is due within 18 months of the Act's enactment. The Comptroller General will submit a report to Congress evaluating the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund. The Fund must provide prior notice of contracts to ensure compliance with Small Business Act requirements. A technical amendment is made to the selection criteria section of the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994. The Fund selects community development financial institution applicants based on scoring system results and review panel recommendations.
